item.title: Yurburg Section B Row 1
item.content:encoded:
Yurburg Section B, Row 1

Click on each photo for more info

B1, row 1, column 1
B5, row 1, column 6
B10, row 1, column 11
B3, row 1, column 3
B6, row 1, column 7
B11, row 1, column 12
B3.1, row 1, column 3
B8, row 1, column 9
B12, row 1, column 13
B4, row 1, column 4
B9, row 1, column 10

Yurburg B1

Row 1, Column 1

The Star of David
Here lies buried

A modest elderly woman
and with a generous heart, she spread forth her palms
to the poor and she sent sent forth her hand to the poor
Ms. Rachel
         Krom(Kerem)
The Daughter of R Moshe the Kohen
Who went to her eternal resting place on the 13th
of Adar II in the year 5684 (1924)
            Rochel Krom
                  1924

Yurburg B3 & B3.1

Row 1, Column 3

Our father (strong) and endearing
A generous heart, his palms were spread out
To the poor and his had sent forth to the hungry
A man who feared God                   he
                      Our teacher our Rabbi [Aron]
The son of Hayiim Rosenfeld
Who went to his eternal rest with a good name

[                              ] in the year 5674 (1914)

 

 

Magen David [Zion]

The elderly woman
The important Ms

Ruchame Chaimovski
The daughter of R Yisrael the Cohen
She departed[                           ]
Sabbath in the year 56[3]2 (1872)
May her soul be bound in the bonds of life

Yurburg B4

Row 1, Column 4

Here lies buried
A pure and upright man, our teacher the Rav
Yitzchak the son of [                   ]
Abrahamson
He departed on the        day of the month of Tevet
The year 5675 (1915) departing
May his soul be bound up in the bonds of life

Yurburg B5

Row 1, Column 6

Magen David
Here lies buried
Our dear father, Our Teacher Rav
Joseph the son of Shimon
Nachman the Cohen    Kaplan
who went to his eternal resting place
Forsaking us for eternal rest
He departed with a good name
On the 9th day of the month
of Shevat in the year 5678 (1918)
May his soul be bound in the bonds of life

Yurburg B6

Row 1, Column 7

Here lies buried
A dear man, a master
of good virtues
R Yaakov
the son of Judah
Yapo
He departed with a good name
On the 21st day of Adar II
In the year 564[   ]  188[0-9]

Yurburg B8

Row 1, Column 9

NOTE: Part of the same headstone as B-7

In the eternal home
The dear young boy
Aaron
the son of the Shliach Tzibur (the Cantor) Isaac David
Alperovitz
He departed on the first day of Shavuot
In the year 5675 (1915)

Yurburg B9

Row 1, Column 10

Magen David
Here lies buried
Our dear father
A God fearing man, the Holy
R. Yisrael Yitchak
The son of R. Mordechai
Most (Mast)
He departed with a good name on the 6 of Shevat
In the year 5679 (1919)

Yurburg B10

Row 1, Column 11

Magen David
Here lies buried
Our elderly father, a God-fearing man
The esteemed Mr. Israel David
the son of Moshe Levine who departed
with a good name, well satisfied (having lived a good full life)
         on the 19th of Shevat
In the year 5680 (1920)
May his soul be bound up in the bonds of life

Yurburg B11

Row 1, Column 12

Magen David
Here lies buried

An upright man who went
And his hand worked(*1)  Our Teacher Our Rav
Gershon the son of Judah
Werbelovski
He went to his eternal resting place
On the 26th of Hesvhan in the year 5681 (1921)
May his soul be bound up in the bonds of life

(*1) Perhaps a euphemism meaning a hard worker, perhaps for the community

Yurburg B12

Row 1, Column 13

Here lies buried
Our dear father, Our Teacher the Rav
Eliyahu
the son of Abraham
Kushner
[Acrononym unknown] in purity on the 6th
of Mar Heshvan 5683 (1923)
May his soul be bound up in the bonds of life

item.title: Yurburg Section B Row 2
item.content:encoded:
Yurburg Section B, Row 2

Click on each photo for more info

B14, row 2, column 2
B19, row 2, column 7
B23, row 2, column 11
B27, row 2, column 15
B16, row 2, column 4
B20, row 2, column 8
B24, row 2, column 12
B17, row 2, column 5
B21, row 2, column 9
B25, row 2, column 13
B18, row 2, column 6
B22, row 2, column 10
B26, row 2, column 14

Yurburg B14

Row 2, Column 2

Note: Much of the stone is an educated guess.

Here lies buried
A dear man, a generous heart
Menachem the son of
Jacob             
              Lotaman
He departed with a good name
                        24
                     5648(1888)
May his soul be bound up in the bonds of life.

Yurburg B16

Row 2, Column 4

Magen David
Here lies buried
The elderly woman
Endearing Mrs
Hanah the daughter of R. Mahnes
Berkavar
She departed a goodly age
on the 24th of Elul
The year 5677 (1917)
May her soul be bound in the bonds of life

Yurburg B17

Row 2, Column 5

Magen David
Here lies buried

The endearing woman
Mrs. Miriam Rivkah
the daughter of R. Josef
Shapiro
She went to her eternal rest
With a good namethe 28th
day of Tevet in the year 5676(1916)

Yurburg B18

Row 2, Column 6

Magen David
Here lies buried
Our mother Shanah the daughter
of Isaac
Haselkovitz
She departed on the 7 of Adar in the year
5675 (1915) May her soul be bound in the bonds of life

Yurburg B19

Row 2, Column 7

Magen David
Here lies buried
A modest, endearing woman
Mrs. Yehudit the daughter of R
Avraham Levine (Lewin)
She departed with a good name
and full satisfied (in life), on the 3rd of Nisan
In the year5675 (1915)
May her soul be bound up in the bonds of life

Yurburg B20

Row 2, Column 8

     Magen David
     Here lies buried

We, the daughters of our mother,
cry over the death of our modest mother
Mrs. Faige Malkah of Rotwine
The daughter of R David Pearlman who went
To her eternal resting place on the 27th day of the month of
Tishrei 5679 (1919)
    May her soul be bound in the bonds of life

Yurburg B21

Row 2, Column 9

Note: Transcription and translation are best guess attempts

 

Here lies buried
A dear man
Tzvi Yehudah [the son of]
Shlomo Palmin
He departed with a good name
On the seventh day
Of the 18th of the Month of Tamuz
In the year 5676 (1916)
May his soul be bound up in the bonds of life

Yurburg B22

Row 2, Column 10

Magen David
Here lies buried
A pure and upright man, our teacher our Rabbi
Bezalel the son ofTzvi
Berkovar
He departed with a good name
Going to his eternal rest on the 11th day of
Iyar in the year 5676 (1916)
May his soul be bound in the bonds of life

Yurburg B23

Row 2, Column 11

The elderly and dear woman
Mrs. Pesha Lovine [Levine]
the daughter or R. Moses. She departed
with a good name and a full life
On the 10th of Tevet in the year 5679 (1919)
May her soul be bound in the bonds of life

Yurburg B24

Row 2, Column 12

Sore Pesche
Singermann

 

Magen David
Here lies buried
Sarah Peshah
Singerman
The daughter of R Judah
Who departed on Thursday, the 6th day of the month
of Teve in the year 5678 (1918)
May her soul be bound in the bonds of life

Yurburg B25

Row 2, Column 13

Magen David
Here lies buried
A man [       ] and who walked upright Our teacher the Rav
Dov Beer
[the son of]                     Judah
      [      ]lovitz

                   on the day
56[76]
         May his soul be bound in the bonds of life
1916

Yurburg B26

Row 2, Column 14

Magen David
Here lies buried

Our dear father
R. Yitzchak Lev
the son of Hayiim Zev
Yafo
He departed on the 10th day
of the month of Iyar
In the year 5677 (1917)
May his soul be bound in the bonds of life

Yurburg B27

Row 2, Column 15

Magen David
Here lies buried

The woman Sarah
Freida Berolovitz
She departed on the 23rd of Adar 5677
Acronym heh-nunthe second followed by an abbreivation heh-yud (presumably life)
May her soul be bound in the bonds of life

item.title: Yurburg Section B Row 3
item.content:encoded:
Yurburg Section B, Row 3

Click on each photo for more info

B28, row 3, column 1
B32, row 3, column 5
B29, row 3, column 2
B33, row 3, column 6
B30, row 3, column 3
B31, row 3, column 4

Yurburg B28

Row 3, Column 1

Magen David
Here lies buried

An important and endearing woman
Her seal was integrity and uprightness
To those who were poor, she was praised

Mrs. Hasyah Henah
Behrman
the daughter of R. Shmuel
She departed on the    [       ] day
of the month of Mar Heshvan in the year 56 [           ]
May her soul be bound in the bonds of life.

Yurburg B30

Row 3, Column 3

Here lies buried
A woman of valor modest and upright
Hetz’lah the daughter of R Dov
Zondolovitz
of the Bernstein family (maiden name)
She departed with a good name
On the 25th of Tamuz in the year 5683 (1923)
May her soul be bound in the bonds of life

Yurburg B31

Row 3, Column 4

A weeping tree
Over the death of our mother
The endearing, modest, and upright
Mrs. Faigah Yentah
The Daughter of R Hayiim Yazleet
She went to her eternal rest
Forsaking us to rest eternally
On Rosh Hodesh Iyaar 5683 (1983)
May her soul be bound in the bonds of life

Yurburg B32

Row 3, Column 5

Here lies buried
Our dear father , a crown [            ]
A man, a teacher
Avraham Yehudah the son of R
Natan Netah
Welantzuk
From Raznov        our father
And the spirit alighted                     [ his heart]
              from him to eternity
He departed in the year 5674 (1914) on the first day of the month of Iyar
May his soul be bound up in the bonds of life

Yurburg B33

Row 3, Column 6

item.title: Yurburg Section B Row 4
item.content:encoded:
Yurburg Section B, Row 4

Click on each photo for more info

B34, row 4, column 1
B54, row 4, column 18
B35, row 4, column 2
B40, row 4, column 7
B44, row 4, column 11

Yurburg B34

Row 4, Column 1

Here lies buried
He walked as a man of complete faith
The purity of his acts were for good
Day and night were devoted
To Torah and to prayer.  His name
was known for praise and for glory
Eleazer the son of Judah
The Cohen, Shapira
He departed and was buried on the 6th day
Of the month of Av in the year 5674 (1914)
May his soul be bound in the bonds of life

Yurburg B35

Row 4, Column 2

Not readable.

May this person’s soul be bound in the bonds of life

Yurburg B40

Row 4, Column 7

A broken stone
A man
He walked [the waters?]
From the family [Washlin]
[                   ]
Our teacher our Rabbi Hayiim Tzvi
the son of our teacher our Rabbi Avraham
The Cohen, may his memory be for blesing
He departed with a good name
[                             ]
In the year 5642 (1882)
May his soul be bound in the bonds of life

Yurburg B44

Row 4, Column 11

Magen David
Here lies buried
Our teacher our Rav Raphael the son of
Naphtali [               ] the Levi
Feinberg
He departed with a good name [       ] in the year
5644(1884) May his soul be bound in the bonds of life

Yurburg B51

Row 4, Column 18

Here lies buried
An upright man he walked
Plesant [                  ]
He departed in [                   ]
Elderly, his days fully satisfied,
Israel the son of
Shemirah Shevi
A lively spirit [                 ]
On the thirteen day of the month
of Elul in the year 5666
May his soul be bound in the bonds of life

item.title: Yurburg Section B Row 5
item.content:encoded:
Yurburg Section B, Row 5

Click on each photo for more info

B54, row 5, column 3
B67, row 5, column 16
B73, row 5, column 22

Yurburg B54

Row 5, Column 3

Not readable

May this person’s soul be bound in the bonds of life.

Yurburg B67

Row 5, Column 16

Some letters are readable and we are grateful to Rita for her restoration of this stone.  It is difficult because, based on her restorations, there appears to be several names on the stones.  These include David, Zalkinber(g) (it is possible that the זל that forms part of this word could be for the abbreviation זכרונה לברכה but this leaves unexplained the word []יקברג that follows) and then most definitely Feinberg which appears two lines underneath, Year of death is 5641 (1881).

May this person’s soul be bound in the bonds of life.

Yurburg B73

Row 5, Column 22

Many letters readable, but it may be in Yiddish. Requires further study.

May this person’s soul be bound in the bonds of life

item.title: Yurburg Section B Row 6
item.content:encoded:
Yurburg Section B, Row 6

Click on each photo for more info

B74, row 6, column 1
B84, row 6, column 12
B92, row 6, column 20
B76, row 6, column 3
B87, row 6, column 15
B93, row 6, column 21
B82, row 6, column 10
B90, row 6, column 18
B83, row 3, column 11
B91, row 6, column 19

Yurburg B74

Row 6, Column 1

Here lies buried
A dear Man
R Yoel the son of Shlomo Zalkind
Feinberg
He departed with a good name
On the 24th of Tishre 56[ 4] [ ]  (1880-1889)
May his soul be bound in the bonds of life

Yurburg B76

Row 6, Column 3

Note: This is a large stone, the top half is not readable.  At the bottom is the inscription

My rabbi my teacher
David the son of Z’rusmah [?]
Sondalowitch

Yurburg B82

Row 6, Column 10

Magen David
Zion

Our dear father
The righteous Rav, our teacher the Rav
Jacob
the son of the Rav Moshe, may the righteous be remembered for
          blessing,
Epstein
He departed with a good name on the 12 of Tevet
5661 (1901).  May his soul be bound in the bonds of life.

Yurburg B83

Row 6, Column 11

Magen David
Here lies buried

The Master [of our home] our dear father,
Our teacher our Rav
Shmuel the son of R Yechezkel
Urbach
He departed on the 18th of Kislev 5661 (1901)
May his soul be bound in the bonds of life

Yurburg B84

Row 6, Column 12

And Isaac went forth

To meditate in the shaded field of his burial place
In his Torah (scholarship), his wisdom and all of his righteousness
The Rabbi Rav Yitzchak the son of R. Yechezkel, may his memory
         be for blessing
[Sh]apr ik
He departed with a good name on the 16 of Kislev
5657 (1897).  May his memory be for blessing

-----
The second line is a reference to Genesis 24:63.  This the prelude to when Isaac meets Rebecca wherein it states  and Isaac went out to meditate in the field

Yurburg B87

Row 6, Column 15

The headstone

The burial of a wealthy woman
Mrs. Dovorah the daughter of R
Judah Lev[aleph resh abbrev unknown] R Yitzchak Lev

Dora Sondelowitz
She departed on the 16 of Elul 5663 (1903).

May her soul be bound in the bonds of life.

Yurburg B90

Row 6, Column 18

A stone wall

A great calamity
On the eve of the great joy (?)
To eternity, she has gone to sleep
Unto the universe, you taste
Abundance, you were plucked away
A tender boy, you foresaken
[and his oppression?] my mother
Gilah Raizah
the daughter of R. Tzvi Saron
The darkness of spring, were your days
Thirty-six years was your life
My eyes shed tears
For you have gone up to heaven
On the 22nd of Tevet 5669 (1909)

May your soul be bound in the bonds of heaven.

Yurburg B91

Row 6, Column 19

Here lies buried
A modest woman
And important Ms.
Hindah Rachel
the daughter of R Hayim the Cohen
Rabinowitz
She departed on teh 29th
Of the month of Kislev
In the year 5670 (1910)
May her soul be bound in the bonds of life

Yurburg B92

Row 6, Column 20

Here lies buried
A Woman
God-fearing
Ms. Pasiah the daughter of
R. Avraham the wife of
R. David Levinsohn
She departed with a good name
On the 24th of Sevat in the year 5671 (1911)

May her soul be bound in the bonds of life

Yurburg B93

Row 6, Column 21

Here lies buried
A man of life, his works abundant
A fear of the Heaven and one who engaged in the needs
of the community faithfully, Our teacher our Rabbi
R Shmuel the son of R
Yaakov Naividal
He departed with a good name on
the 2nd day of the month of Iyar in the year
[5670] 1910, he so departed (from)  Yurburg
May he bound in the bonds of life

item.title: Yurburg Section B Row 7
item.content:encoded:
Yurburg Section B, Row 7

Click on each photo for more info

B94, row 7, column 1
B95, row 7, column 2
B102, row 7, column 9
B107, row 7, column 14

Yurburg B94

Row 7, Column 1

Zion
Here lies buried
Jacob David
the son of R. Zadoknah
Joselit

whose life was praiseworthy to everyone
 [      ]   year [                     ]

[unknown acronym]

Yurburg B95

Row 7, Column 2

May he rest in peace here
          [In the city of?]
And our father, endearing and upright, our rabbi R.
David
Shlomo the son of Zvi
Jablonsky
He left this world at the age of 51
On the 29th of Mar Cheshvan 5671
That may his soil lie in grace (?)

------
No inscription of "May his soul be bound in the bonds of life." 

Yurburg B102

Row 7, Column 9

Here lies buried
A very old man (alternative trans. “rejoice”)
Pious, a wonder in Torah
And one who feared heaven
A principled and [ ] man
Our teacher our Rabbi, R. Shalom, the son of R
Israel the Cohen
He was called by the mouth of everyone
R. Shalom Wilnar (alternative Wolnar)
He departed with a good man, elderly,
(His) days fully sated, on the 13th day of the Month
of Adar 1 5648 (1898)
May his soul be bound in the bonds of life

-------
This stone is beautifully restored.  It is possible that in the course of restoration that certain letters have other possibilities.  However, as can be seen with the stones immediately preceding, without this work, it would not have been readable at all.  Another example of the magnificence of Rita’s beautiful work.

Yurburg B107

Row 7, Column 14

Magen David
Here lies buried
The young man our teacher our Rav
Moses
the son of R. Shemayhu
Borski
Who departed [value] in the year 5658 (1898)
During the month of Av
May his soul be bound in the bonds of life

item.title: Yurburg Section B Row 9
item.content:encoded:
Yurburg Section B, Row 9

Click on each photo for more info

B122, row 9, column 2
B133, row 9, column 14
B123, row 9, column 3
B125, row 9, column 6
B127, row 9, column 8

Yurburg B122

Row 9, Column 2

Here lies buried
A God-Fearing man who walked in purity
Our teacher r Yechezkel Walim
the son of our teacher our Rav, R. Yaakov the Cohen
          may his memory be for a blessing
He departed with a good name on Tuesday
The 7th day of the month of Kislev
In the year 5650 (1890)

Yurburg B123

Row 9, Column 3

A Stone                                                                Astone
My daughter, a soft child                                   My dear, upright father
[lit. overclouding the dancer]                              Among men, he earned
                                                                             his living
She walked quietly during her life                     His hands toiled
Ms. Hayah Peshah                                              Judah the son of Ari
                                                                             Galgishar, he departed
She departed with a good name                         With a good name [      ]
On the 7th of Av 5640 (1880)                                      5640
May her soul be bound in the                                      May his soul be bound
          bonds of life                                               in the bonds of life

Yurburg B125

Row 9, Column 6

Here lies buried
How awful [the great] 
To judge correctly over humanity
Man and women - their days are like dust
The children shall weep over[the one who has been destroyed]
Loving kindness and charity endlessly beating
Purity upon purity to come to eternity
She is my mother, my teacher, the modest
Mrs. Leah Krelitz
The daughter of R. Hillel who departed
On the fourth day
Of the month of Shevat in the year
5665 (1905)
May her soul be bound in the bonds of life.

Yurburg B127

Row 9, Column 8

Here lies buried
A [pleasant] elderly man[    ]  The Rav Rabbi
Israel
the son of Tzvi Hersch [Azapowitz]
He departed with a good name
On Friday, the eve of the Holy Sabbath on the 27th day
Of the Month of Kislev the year 5646 [1886]
May his soul be bound in the bonds of life.

Yurburg B133

Row 9, Column 14

May this person’s soul be bound in the bonds of life

item.title: Yurburg Section B Row 10
item.content:encoded:
Yurburg Section B, Row 10

Click on each photo for more info

B138, row 10, column 3

Yurburg B138

Row 10, Column 3

Here lies buried
Mrs Deborah
Lewinson (Levinsohn)
The daughter of R. Elikum
Who departed on Monday, the 12th of Adar
In the year 5644 (1884)
